intro: Morinda sessiliflora, commonly known as the African star apple or wild mango, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are often elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, clustered white flowers that are followed by round, fleshy fruits resembling small apples. The fruit contains a single large seed surrounded by a sweet, edible pulp. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique fruit.
